intro: Bouvardia hernan-maganae, commonly known as the Mexican Bouvardia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, fragrant, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, featuring glossy, elliptical leaves. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Bouvardia hernan-maganae is also valued for its ability to bloom throughout the year under optimal conditions.
